title: Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh: Main accused held; 21 arrested so far
content: Police arrested Yasin Arafat, the main suspect in the murder of Hindu worker Dipu Chandra Das. Arafat, a former madrasa teacher, allegedly led a mob that attacked and killed Das. This incident follows a period of unrest in Bangladesh. Twenty-one people have been arrested in connection with the case. Nine have given confessional statements.

title: From Op Sindoor to Venezuela: How Chinese weapons, radars keep failing ‚Äî Explained
content: China's arms exports faced a significant setback as its weapons, including air defence systems like the HQ-9 and JY-27A radar, proved ineffective during India's Operation Sindoor and a recent Venezuelan operation. These incidents highlighted a technological gap, with Russian-supplied missiles also failing to perform. The failures have damaged China's reputation as a reliable arms supplier.

title: 'CM's aides removed evidence': ED's big charge against Mamata; I-PAC raids trigger row
content: The Enforcement Directorate accused West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee of obstructing a money-laundering probe into a coal smuggling syndicate. The ED claims Banerjee, accompanied by police, entered a residence and I-PAC office, seizing documents and electronic devices. Banerjee rejected the allegations, calling the searches politically motivated and an attempt to seize TMC's election strategy.

title: Exclusive: Why no Hikaru? Inside new FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship
content: FIDE and Freestyle Chess ended a long-running dispute over world championship authority by agreeing to stage the first official FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. The conflict began in late 2024 over title rights, sparking public clashes and player concerns. A renewed dialogue in 2025 led to reconciliation, aligning Freestyle‚Äôs tour with FIDE governance and creating a unified championship framework.

title: 'Axis of war': Russia warns EU over peacekeeping force in Ukraine; takes shot at US
content: Russia has branded Ukraine and its allies an "axis of war," calling the proposed peacekeeping force deployments plan "dangerous" and "destructive". Moscow warned that any such troops would be considered legitimate military targets. This strong reaction follows new security guarantees announced for Kyiv. Meanwhile, the US seized a Russian-flagged tanker, which Moscow claims will escalate tensions.

title: Wealth tax row: LinkedIn founder on California‚Äôs billionaire tax ‚Äî 'badly designed, harmful to innovation'
content: LinkedIn founder Reid Hoffman has joined the opposition to California's proposed 5% wealth tax on billionaires, calling it 'badly designed' with 'massive flaws' that could harm innovation. He expressed concerns about taxing illiquid stock and warned of potential capital flight and reduced revenue. Hoffman acknowledged Congressman Ro Khanna's goal to balance Silicon Valley's growth with broader inclusion.

title: Explained: Will Venezuelan crude lead to cheap petrol for American consumers?
content: The timing matters. Oil prices are already under pressure globally, and petrol prices have eased after years of inflation-driven pain. The Venezuela pitch is being sold as a way to lock that relief in.

title: Did Sidda celebrate record of longest-serving CM prematurely?
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's supporters celebrated a 'country chicken feast' for his tenure, though the official record as longest-serving CM is days away. Political analysts questioned the premature fanfare amidst speculation about leadership changes.  Siddaramaiah, however, highlighted his government's achievements and dismissed opposition criticism.

title: US consulate issues fresh warning to B1/B2 visa holders ‚Äî what is it?
content: The US Consulate General in Mumbai has issued a warning to B1/B2 visitor visa holders regarding unauthorized employment. Engaging in work activities not permitted by the visa can lead to deportation and a potential lifetime ban from entering the United States. Travelers are advised to understand visa regulations before planning their trips.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: ‚ÄòBramayugam‚Äô: Mammootty film enters Oscar Academy space
content: Mammootty's film 'Bramayugam' is set for a prestigious screening at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures in Los Angeles on February 12, 2026. This marks the first time a Mammootty-starrer will be shown at the museum, as part of the 'Where the Forest Meets the Sea' folk horror series.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
content: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: VHT: Sarfaraz scripts history; smokes 30 off Abhishek to record fastest-ever fifty
content: Sarfaraz Khan smashed the fastest fifty in Vijay Hazare Trophy history. His explosive 62 off 20 balls was a highlight. Mumbai narrowly lost to Punjab by one run. Punjab finished top of Group C. Both teams qualified for the quarter-finals.

title: How ICE shot a mother in cold blood - and Trump defended it
content: Family members and neighbours told local reporters that she was not participating in protests or attempting to interfere with law enforcement on the day of the shooting. She was described as someone who had recently been navigating significant personal change, including the loss of her former spouse, while focusing on caring for her children and settling into daily life in the city.

title: More degrees, fewer jobs: Why India‚Äôs educated women are still shut out of the workforce
content: India‚Äôs rising female enrolment in higher education masks a deeper economic failure. Despite earning degrees in record numbers, only about one-third of Indian women are considered employable, according to TeamLease data. Sectoral barriers, persistent pay gaps, and weak career pipelines continue to push women out of the workforce, turning educational gains into stalled economic progress.

title: 'Slow down? That‚Äôs not fast bowling': The belief that shaped Mitchell Starc
content: Mitchell Starc‚Äôs Ashes heroics capped a series that underlined both his durability and evolution. As the left-armer moves closer to the game‚Äôs all-time highest wicket-takers, his childhood coach Neil de Costa recalls the defining philosophy that shaped Starc‚Äôs career: bowl fast, swing hard and ignore anyone who tells you otherwise.

title: JEE Main 2026 exam dates revised: Check complete schedule here
content: The National Testing Agency has revised the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 schedule, with exams now set from January 21 to January 29 instead of January 30. The exam city slip has been released on the official website. Admit cards are expected in the second week of January, while Paper 1 and Paper 2 exams will be held in multiple shifts.

title: Big surprise in Maharashtra civic polls: 12 suspended Congress corporators join BJP
content: Twelve Congress corporators and a former Block President, suspended for aligning with the BJP in Ambernath Municipal Council, have officially joined the Bharatiya Janata Party. State BJP President Ravindra Chavan welcomed them, citing their commitment to city development as the reason for induction. This move follows a controversial local alliance that aimed to foster civic governance and development in Ambernath.

title: New labour codes: What they mean for employees? Salary & benefits rules explained
content: New Labour Codes explained: The draft rules released by the government are important because they outline several key provisions on how employees' wages, salary, allowances and gratuity benefits are structured.

title: The quiet unease beneath an AI-led hiring boom: Why 80% of people feel unprepared for work in 2026
content: A new LinkedIn report reveals a 2026 job market marked by uncertainty, with 80% of job seekers feeling unprepared and recruiters struggling to find quality talent.  AI is reshaping hiring, making it more data-driven but less transparent.  This creates a confidence gap, as both sides navigate evolving, algorithm-driven processes where visibility depends on machine-readable signals.

title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US
content: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: JEE Main 2026 city intimation slip for Session 1 released at NTA website: Direct link to download here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 city intimation slip for lakhs of students. This slip informs candidates of their exam city, aiding in advance travel and accommodation planning. It is crucial to note that this is not the admit card, which will be issued separately.

title: Glenn Hall dies at 94: Remembering Mr Goalie, NHL ironman legend
content: Glenn Hall, one of the toughest goaltenders the NHL has ever seen, passed away at the age of 94. Known as ‚ÄúMr. Goalie,‚Äù he set an unmatched ironman record by starting 502 straight games and changed how the position was played. A Hall of Famer and Stanley Cup champion, his impact on the game will be remembered for generations.

title: 'Shameful, embarrassing': After clip shared by student, civic body erases defaced murals on Gwalior wall
content: A viral video of defaced yoga murals in Gwalior, shared by a Class 11 student, sparked outrage. The artwork, part of a Smart City initiative, was marred by vulgar markings. Following public outcry and an influencer's repair attempt, the Municipal Corporation repainted the wall white and plans a Gen Z art event to promote positive messages.

title: ‚ÄòCan‚Äôt read a man‚Äôs mind too‚Äô: Actor Ramya reacts to SC remark on stray dogs
content: Actor Divya Spandana's social media post comparing unpredictable animals to men sparked debate after a Supreme Court observation on street dogs and public safety. The court emphasized the dangers posed by stray animals on roads, urging civic bodies to strictly implement rules for their management and removal.

title: SBI projects 7.5% GDP growth! FY26 figures may surpass govt estimates
content: India's economic expansion in FY26 might surpass official forecasts, with a revised GDP base year potentially pushing growth closer to 7.5%. While agriculture growth is set to moderate, the services sector is expected to be the primary driver, projecting a robust 9.1% expansion. Industrial output will see a slight uptick, though mining output is anticipated to decline.

title: Fugitive wife killer living as Punjabi carpenter caught by police 26 years later
content: A carpenter in Ludhiana, living under an assumed identity for 14 years, was apprehended by Delhi Police. He was a fugitive, having escaped parole in 2000 after being sentenced for his wife's murder in 1992.  The police tracked him down through a tip-off, ending his decade-long evasion.

title: Missing since December, woman‚Äôs skeletal remains found 300 metres from her house in UP
content: A skeleton, believed to be that of a 30-year-old missing woman, was discovered in a mustard field near her home in Nagram. Family members identified a sari found at the scene, leading to suspicions about her husband, who is now under investigation. The remains have been sent for post-mortem to confirm identity and cause of death.

title: Delhi pollution is deadlier than you think: Ask your heart
content: A pilot study in Delhi revealed a direct link between rising air pollution and cardiovascular emergencies, with admissions increasing significantly with spikes in AQI, PM10, and PM2.5. In contrast, Shimla showed no such correlation, highlighting the severe short-term health impacts of pollution in urban areas.

title: Ashes: 'I am sorry' - Harry Brook's apology puts spotlight on England's off-field conduct
content: England's white-ball captain Harry Brook has publicly apologised for a nightclub altercation in New Zealand, admitting his behaviour was wrong and caused embarrassment. The incident, which occurred before the Ashes tour, resulted in a fine and a final warning. This apology surfaces as the ECB begins a thorough review of the team's disappointing Ashes campaign, with off-field conduct under scrutiny.

title: Delhi: 3 days after motorist fell off Wazirpur flyover, another critically injured
content: Two men have fallen from the Wazirpur flyover in Delhi within three days, with one fatality and another critically injured. Police suspect an engineering defect due to a one-foot gap between carriageways and inadequate barriers. They are writing to the concerned agency to examine structural flaws and have recommended speed breakers and barriers.

title: UP govt cancels assistant professor recruitment exam after paper leak
content: The Uttar Pradesh government has cancelled the assistant professor recruitment exam. This decision follows serious irregularities and a paper leak. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered the cancellation after an inquiry confirmed the issues. The exam was held last year for over a thousand posts. The government assures a fair and transparent process for the new exam dates.

title: Human-elephant conflict spikes in Jharkhand, 22 people dead in 21 days
content: Jharkhand faces a severe human-elephant conflict, with 22 deaths in 21 days. A rogue elephant in West Singhbhum, in musth, has killed 16 since January 1, while another in Ramgarh turned violent after being attacked. Operations are hampered by IEDs. Villagers in vulnerable areas are being relocated.

title: Confidential data leaked? Japan nuclear regulator loses phone in China
content: Japan's nuclear safety regulator reported a work-issued smartphone containing sensitive contact details of nuclear security personnel was lost by an employee during a personal trip to China. The device, used for disaster communication, did not access facility data but held confidential information, raising security concerns.

title: Jana Nayagan: Why is the Thalapathy Vijay starrer postponed?
content: Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' faces an indefinite postponement due to extensive cuts and mutes mandated by the CBFC, alongside ongoing court proceedings. Over 50 politically sensitive dialogues were muted, and violent scenes blacked out, impacting the film's release. Pongal court holidays further stall immediate judicial resolutions, forcing producers to delay the theatrical launch.

title: National shooting coach suspended after minor accuses him of sexual harassment
content: India's shooting coach Ankush Bhardwaj has been suspended by the National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) following a sexual harassment accusation by a minor shooter. An FIR has been filed against Bhardwaj, who was recommended by the NRAI for a coaching role post-Paris Olympics. The incident reportedly occurred last month after a training session.

title: Gen Z uprising in Pakistan? PhD student's article challenges those in power ‚Äî why it was taken down
content: A PhD student's article, "It is over," critically examining Pakistan's ruling establishment and Gen Z's disillusionment, sparked widespread debate. The piece, later removed from publication, argued that young Pakistanis see through imposed patriotism and demand justice and opportunity, signaling a potential shift from quiet discontent to open resistance.

title: BJP-AIMIM tie-up in Akot collapses hours after CM Fadnavis warning
content: An alliance between BJP and AIMIM in Akola's Akot town collapsed within hours after CM Devendra Fadnavis warned of action. The state BJP issued a show-cause notice to Akot MLA Prakash Bharsakale for promoting the arrangement without party consultation. A new front, 'Akot Nagar Vikas Manch', formed with support from multiple parties, claimed majority.

title: Sportsmanship debate: 'Kids look up to him' - Carlsen's outbursts cast shadow over chess
content: Magnus Carlsen's repeated emotional outbursts, including slamming boards and scattering pieces, have sparked debate about sportsmanship in elite chess. While FIDE prioritizes commercial success, critics argue that unaddressed behavior sends the wrong message to young players who idolize the world champion.

title: Silver slides Rs 10k on MCX: March 2026 future prices fall nearly 3%; what's the outlook?
content: Silver prices experienced a significant drop of Rs 10,000 on Thursday, with March 2026 futures plummeting. This sharp correction follows December's record high, signaling market instability. HSBC forecasts a gradual decline in silver prices over the next few years, citing weakening industrial and jewelry demand, despite a projected deficit. Increased mining output also contributes to the bearish outlook.

title: Rahila Firdous' journey: Engineering degree, keeping gloves & Dhoni as idol | EXCLUSIVE
content: Bhopal-born cricketer Rahila Firdous, inspired by Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni, has earned an engineering degree while honing her cricket skills. After impressive domestic performances, she was picked by Mumbai Indians for Rs 10 lakh in the WPL auction, a significant career leap. Rahila is eager to learn from skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and leverage the WPL platform for growth.

title: Khawaja Asif says Pakistan may not need IMF loans soon ‚Äî what's behind the claim
content: Pakistan's defence minister claims a surge in aircraft orders, potentially ending IMF reliance within six months. This follows a military standoff with India and discussions with Bangladesh and Saudi Arabia for JF-17 fighter jet deals. The Pak minister expressed strong confidence in these orders materializing, suggesting a significant boost to Pakistan's economy.

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Sources: Hawks end Young era, send G to Wiz
content: The Hawks are trading four-time All-Star Trae Young to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert, sources said.

title: Chiefs 'aware' of abuse allegations by Rice's ex
content: The Chiefs acknowledged Wednesday that they are aware of domestic violence allegations made by a woman who is the ex-girlfriend of Rashee Rice, with the team saying it's in communication with the league and will have no additional comment at this time.

title: Jim Harbaugh hails John, hopes he's NFC-bound
content: Jim Harbaugh doesn't expect his older brother John to be out of a job very long but just hopes his next landing spot isn't in the AFC, where the Chargers reside. "As I told him, whatever team he goes to is going to be formidable," Jim said.

title: Spurs' Sochan: 'Polite exchange' with Vanderbilt
content: Spurs forward Jeremy Sochan downplayed the severity of a postgame incident Wednesday that involved Lakers forward Jarred Vanderbilt poking him in the face.

title: Lipsey touted as best PG in nation after ISU win
content: Iowa State coach T.J. Otzelberger declared Tamin Lipsey the nation's best point guard after he led the Cyclones past Baylor and to the first 15-0 start in program history Wednesday night.

title: Scheffler to make '26 debut at American Express
content: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler will make his 2026 debut at the American Express Championship later this month, tournament officials said Wednesday night. Scheffler also has committed to the WM Phoenix Open.

title: Sources: Rockies, Lorenzen agree to $8M contract
content: Right-hander Michael Lorenzen and the Rockies are in agreement on a one-year, $8 million contract that includes a club option, sources told ESPN.

title: HOF goalie Hall, who started 502 in a row, dies
content: Glenn Hall, a Hockey Hall of Famer whose streak of 502 consecutive starts as a goaltender remains an NHL record, has died. He was 94.

title: üèà Our latest NFL mock draft predicts Picks 1-32
content: Which QB fits with the Raiders at No. 1? How high could Jeremiyah Love go? Will the Buckeyes run the first round? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

title: Who is going to the Super Bowl? Barnwell predicts 13 games across the entire NFL playoff bracket
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: How Pete Golding got Ole Miss in the CFP semifinals amid coaching turmoil
content: The Rebels seemed to be coming apart a month ago. Now they're one win from playing for a national title.

title: Six NBA trade proposals: How Lakers, Bucks, Warriors and more deals could work
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: MLB midwinter Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings now that we're midway through the offseason.

title: The bizarre world of arbitration -- and the ace whose record raise could rock the system
content: Baseball's unique offseason contract process is built on comps. Enter the pitcher who is beyond comparison.

title: Browns locked in for 'next 120 days': Coach, draft and a QB
content: Are Cleveland's owners letting a 5-12 season weigh them down? Not a chance. They're pressing forward.

title: Mendoza vs. Moore: Why the CFP semifinals will have a big impact on the NFL draft
content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Wetzel: Welcome to a new college football world, where the SEC is no longer undisputed king
content: The Big Ten is guaranteed to be playing for a third straight national title. Can the SEC find a way to dominate this new era like it did the previous one?

title: Secret sauce to Bills beating the Jaguars? A big key is the O-line
content: What makes up the Bills O-line unit's success and its diverse personalities off the field? Let them explain.

title: Best way to an Eagles defensive lineman's heart -- and performance? Meatballs
content: Vic Fangio introduced the Meatball Award this season for his defense to serve as that extra bit of motivation.

title: Roster overhaul, six pillars and the Pittsburgh Steelers: Inside the Kings' latest revamp
content: The Kings fired Mike Brown this time last season, but one year later don't seem any closer to finding their way.

title: Fresh start or back to square one? Either way, Man United are never dull
content: After the tumult of Ruben Amorim's dismissal, Darren Fletcher and United's 2-2 draw vs. Burnley was fittingly dramatic.

title: VAR review: Did Chelsea get away with what should've been a penalty for Fulham?
content: Chelsea could have given up a penalty to Fulham, but the VAR stuck with the on-field decision. Was it the right call?

title: Amber Glenn is finally ready for her Olympic moment
content: This week, Amber Glenn looks to defend her back-to-back national titles -- and become the oldest U.S. Olympic women's singles skater in 98 years.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Inside Raiders' lost 2025 season: Tom Brady's influence, private meetings and dysfunction
content: "Who would want the Raiders job?" The inside story of how the Raiders went from playoff hopes to the No. 1 pick and another fired coach.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: Who are MLB's top young stars? Ranking baseball's best players at every age from 16 to 25
content: Julio Rodriguez or Bobby Witt Jr.? Roman Anthony or Jackson Chourio? We rank baseball's best by birth year.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: 'I had 23': Revisiting the sack ruling that separates Jared Allen and Myles Garrett
content: A 2011 Vikings sack that NFL officials changed a call on seemed to work in Browns' defensive end's favor.

title: Who will be Man United's next manager? 12 top candidates to replace Amorim
content: Whether Manchester United aim to hire quickly or wait until summer, here are the coaches they could be after.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Karl to commit to Bayern after Real Madrid comments
content: Bayern Munich's teenage star Lennart Karl recently courted interest from Real Madrid but is ready to commit his long-term future to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: Don't be surprised if ... Jayson Tatum returns this season, Kawhi Leonard remains hot
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Jayson Tatum, Kawhi Leonard, Cedric Coward and more.

title: Manipur violence: SC orders forensic probe into 'voice recordings' of ex-Manipur CM
content: Representative image The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Jawahirullah urges government to correct addresses of fishers in official records
content: His statement comes after The Hindu on Wednesday (January 7) reported that many residents of fishing hamlets in the city were finding it difficult to update records in Aadhaar and other documents, such as nativity certificates, due to lack of proper addresses

title: Government medical college doctors to go on indefinite strike
content: All teaching activities will be boycotted from January 13, and all non-emergency medical services in medical college hospitals will be discontinued from the week after

title: Indian national stranded on Yemen's island evacuated to Saudi Arabia
content: The development comes as heavy fighting between rival armed factions in Yemen has intensified in recent days

title: Permit only 300 shops on Marina beach, orders Madras High Court
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and A.D. Jagadish Chandira also order that the shops should be allotted through drawal of lots under the supervision of a retired High Court judge

title: Karur stampede: CBI summons police personnel who were deployed for security at TVK chief Vijay‚Äôs rally
content: The CBI, which re-registered the case based on directions from the Supreme Court on October 13, had collected the bandobast plan containing the list of police personnel who were deployed for duty for the TVK rally

title: Backlash after school exam question in Chhattisgarh about dog‚Äôs name has ‚ÄòRam‚Äô as option
content: The incident triggered protests from right-wing outfits in front of the District Education Officer with Vishva Hindu Parishad seeking the arrest and dismissal of those who prepared the question for the exam

title: UIDAI launches mascot Udai to simplify communication on public understanding of Aadhaar
content: The mascot has been selected from various entries received through a national design and name competition on the MyGov platform

title: Miscreants threaten to blast three courts, police conduct searches
content: Unidentified persons sent mails to the judges stating that bombs were planted in Eluru, Madanapalli and Ananthapur courts

title: Delhi riots case: Court issues release orders for fifth accused granted bail
content: The court noted that the accused, Shahdab Ahmed, had fulfilled all bail conditions imposed by the Supreme Court

title: Bomb hoax: police intensify surveillance at Kozhikode Medical College Hospital
content: An email was received at the official ID of medical college Principal claiming that bombs have been placed at the MCH. Inspections find the threat to be hoax

title: Lawyers‚Äô body begins fast against move to shift Gauhati High Court
content: While 154 lawyers of the Gauhati High Court Bar Association voted for the shifting, 1,164 voted against the government decision

title: Life imprisonment for seven RSS-BJP workers for murdering CPI(M) leader at Thalassery in 2008
content: Latheesh, secretary of the CPI(M) Thiruvangad local committee, was hacked to death on the Chakyathmukku beach, near Thalassery. The court found accused numbers one to seven guilty and sentenced them to 35 years of imprisonment on four counts

title: Gadgil: conservationist who saw humans as constituents of the ecosystem
content: Madhav Gadgil would go on to shift the paradigm in the global conservation discourse, giving primacy to human rights over exclusive wildlife protection

title: Himachal High Court receives bomb threat email; security beefed up
content: Upon receiving the information, the bomb squad, dog squad and police reached the court. However, they did not discover any explosives within the court complex, an official said

title: Congress leaders criticise delay in censor board clearance for Vijay‚Äôs Jana Nayagan
content: Referring to her experience as a former member of the censor board, Karur MP Jothimani said the CBFC has become outdated in the present technological era and that it is increasingly being used as a political tool.

title: Mamata Banerjee took away key evidence during raids in coal ‚Äòscam‚Äô case against I-PAC official: ED
content: ED said the actions of Mamata Banerjee and the Kolkata Police commissioner resulted in ‚Äúobstructions‚Äù in the ongoing investigation and proceedings being undertaken as per the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA)

title: AI start-ups ‚Äòco-architects‚Äô of India‚Äôs future, says PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi said that AI start-ups were the ‚Äúco-architects‚Äù of India‚Äôs future and said that the country has immense capacity for both innovation and large-scale implementation

title: Former MLA P.V. Anvar appears before ED for interrogation in connection with suspected fraudulent loan transactions
content: Investigation pertains to loans amounting to ‚Çπ7.5 crore to Malamkulam Constructions and ‚Çπ4.61 crore to Pee Vee Aar Developers, sanctioned by the Kerala Financial Corporation against the same collateral properties within a short span

title: Supreme Court defers hearing on pleas challenging ECI‚Äôs SIR of electoral rolls to January 13
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice Surya Kant, which had fixed the pleas for hearing during the day, said it will resume the proceedings on Tuesday (January 13)

title: Congress leader alleges I-PAC acts as 'eyes, ears' of TMC, questions ED raid
content: I-PAC acts as the eyes and ears of the TMC. They are engaged in framing all sorts of strategies to ensure the win of the TMC, and for that, they can do anything else in exchange for money, alleges Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on plea of Justice Varma assailing validity of inquiry panel by Lok Sabha
content: Senior advocates for Justice Varma questioned the procedure for setting up the parliamentary panel and said only the Speaker of Lok Sabha and chairman of Rajya Sabha are entitled to admit the motion for removal of a judge from office

title: Madhav Gadgil‚Äôs enduring legacy in the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve
content: Gadgil‚Äôs and his students‚Äô research in the Western Ghats, and particularly the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve (NBR), laid the foundation for the recognition of the region‚Äôs immense importance to biodiversity and to its conservation.

title: Were the three big Kannada films ‚ÄòThe Devil‚Äô, ‚ÄòMark‚Äô and ‚Äò45‚Äô worth the hype?
content: December 2025 saw a big box office clash in the Kannada film industry. Despite the pre-release buzz, and grand opening week celebrations by fans, did three movies truly live up to the hype?

title: Three district courts in Chhattisgarh get bomb threat; searches on
content: A police team, along with the Bomb Disposal Squad and dog squad, was immediately sent to the court and the premises was evacuated, a police official said.

title: Special voter registration camps in Chennai on January 10 and 11
content: The camps will be of help to people whose names are missing from the draft electoral roll, young citizens who have recently completed 18 years of age, and voters who need to make changes to their details, according to a press release

title: Kogilu demolition: Two arrested for encroachment of government land in Bengaluru
content: According to police officials, several individuals had illegally occupied government land in Kogilu village and constructed sheds without authorisation

title: 12th century multi-lingual inscription of Hoysala period found at Pandavapura in Karnataka
content: The inscription is carved on white granite that measures about two feet in width and two-and-a-half feet in height. It consists of nine lines of text

title: Stray dogs case: Let public, educational institutions start their own animals cells and not bank on municipal authorities, one of nation‚Äôs oldest law centre tells SC

title: Two Indian Truck Drivers Caught In US With Cocaine 'Enough To Kill 1,13,000 People'

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
